CricketMatch.MatchReport:
On the hottest day of the year so far, Twyford played host to Holyport at Stanlake Meadow. Winning the toss, Twyford captain Nic Downes elected to bat.

A less auspicious start would scarce have been possible, with Woodman clean bowled off the first ball of the innings. The opening bowlers Barney and Head kept the pressure up and by the end of the 8th over Twyford were reeling at 19 for 3. But relief for the batting side came with Dunsford and Cochrane put together an inspired and exciting partnership of 77, lifting Twyford out of the doldrums. And so the form continued throughout the rest of the batting order, with all contributing runs. However, Holyport were bowling tightly, keeping runs at a premium. The final total of 168 for 8 looked too small with the fast outfield parched after the recent weather.

And so it was to prove. Holyport's openers Dunn and Davies spent the first two overs getting ready, and then unleashed a barrage of boundaries. Punishing anything overpitched or slightly off line, they scored at almost 6 an over for the first 15 overs, the frantic progress slowed only when the very much in-form Davies was caught on the boundary for 60. Dunn was dismissed the following over, but the writing was on the wall. Under the bright sun Twyford's bowlers were unable to apply sufficient pressure, and the winning runs came in the 30th over.

A well deserved win for Holyport, though Twyford should not be too discouraged by their performance.

Of course, worse was to follow down the public house afterwards, with the England football team unable to emulate the success of their cricketing counterparts!
